content: Our demo sites were down, but I think that things are restarting. I'll check back soon.
@StPaulTim Seems to be working now...

We're wanting to make demo sandboxes skip the install process for users. These two issues do just that. Feedback welcome!
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/5
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/661

Allow skipping installation · Issue #5 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
When you just want to spin up a demo site to test some core functionality, or anything like that, you often don't want to have to go through the installation process each time. It'd be nice...
Display demo sandbox username & password · Issue #661 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
When backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat#7 is merged then sandboxes will be installed automatically and a default admin username and password set. We'll then need to display that information to the u...
Feedback left @BWPanda (Peter) :slight_smile: ...I believe that we could turn this into a 1-step process!
Thanks for feedback. I'm not sure it'll all be possible or desired, but will look into it...

Sure @BWPanda (Peter) ...I think it'd be best to discuss this with the rest of the gang first, and make a decision. ...in the meantime, thank you for the instructions on how to test the tugboat repo. What do you think about replacing the README with this?: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat/pull/8

Add instructions for testing this repo by klonos · Pull Request #8 · backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat
GitHub is home to over 40 million developers working together to host and review code, manage projects, and build software together.
Not sure whether that should replace main README, or go in the .tugboat directory. I'm leaning towards the latter...

@BWPanda (Peter) FYI - I'm having problems writing config files in Tugboat demo sites.
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/9

Problem writing config files · Issue #9 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
I just tried twice to create a new Demo site on BackdropCMS Tugboat and both times, I was unable to write any config files. Initially, I was trying to edit the home page layout and got this message...
I think I can see the problem, though I don't know what would have changed to make it stop working (assuming it ever did...?) I'll see if I can push a fix later today.

I'm quite sure that it must have worked in the past, because I test lots of stuff on Tugboat and have never had this problem before, including creating content types and changing layouts. Thanks for your work on this.
Seems to have been introduced as a result of auto-installing Backdrop. Fixed now!
(peter)** (Karma: 19)

@BWPanda (Peter) @Nate Lampton I fixed tugboat. I had to delete all the sandboxes, but the button on the home page works again. Something weird happened last night and Tugboat decided to rebuild all the previews. The base preview was missing, so all the rebuilds were huge instead of diff size, so we hit our quota, which caused other problems
I have restored the base preview, but since I am not exactly sure how you had it set up before I would love a second set of eyes on everything :)
I've been meaning to take a look, but between moving overseas, setting up my new computer, and being quarantined in a hotel room with a 2 year old, I haven't had time yet...
